article.title: Buccaneers release DT Chris Hovan
article.body:
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers on Monday released defensive tackle Chris Hovan, ESPN reported.

The report said Hovan was to make $4 million in 2010. However, his days appeared numbered when the Buccaneers used the third pick of the draft on Oklahoma defensive tackle Gerald McCoy and a second-round pick on UCLA defensive tackle Brian Price.

Hovan spent half of his 10 years with Tampa Bay. He had 33 tackles last season.
